sys_metadata_link.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="x_62500_mealplan_recipe"> <x_62500_mealplan_recipe action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <active>true</active> <cook_time/> <cooking_instructions>1. Soak basmati rice in water for 30 minutes, then drain. 2. Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. 3. Add sliced onion and cook until golden brown. 4. Add minced garlic, minced ginger, and chopped green chili. Cook until fragrant. 5. Stir in chopped tomato and cook until soft. 6. Add mixed vegetables and cook for a few minutes. 7. Add biryani masala, turmeric powder, salt, and pepper. Mix well. 8. Layer half of the soaked rice over the vegetable mixture. 9. Sprinkle saffron-infused milk over the rice. 10. Layer the remaining rice over the saffron-infused rice. 11. Cover and cook on low heat for 20-25 minutes, until rice is cooked through. 12. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot.</cooking_instructions> <cuisine display_value="Indian">8f495a179791021069a3b6fce053afcf</cuisine> <diet>bca1c6979711021069a3b6fce053af90</diet> <effort display_value="Moderate">bee0a76e9730021069a3b6fce053af3e</effort> <image/> <ingredients>Basmati Rice (2 cups), Mixed Vegetables </ingredients> <meal_type display_value="Dinner">ca8516df9751021069a3b6fce053afdf</meal_type> <name>Vegetable Biryani</name> <nutrition>Calories: 300, Protein: 10g, Fat: 10g, Carbs: 45g</nutrition> <owned_by/> <pre_cook>false</pre_cook> <prep_instructions>1. Soak basmati rice. 2. Slice onion, chop tomato, mince garlic, ginger, and green chili.</prep_instructions> <prep_required>false</prep_required> <prep_time/> <serving>2</serving> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2024-04-07 01:22:04</sys_created_on> <sys_id>7091d71f9795021069a3b6fce053afdd</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2024-04-07 01:22:04</sys_updated_on> <time_of_day/> </x_62500_mealplan_recipe> </record_update>
